methods.name: CreateAssetData
FindAssetNativeClass
methods.doc:
Returns the first native class of the asset type that can be found.  Normally this is just the FAssetData::GetClass(),
however if the class is a blueprint generated class it may not be loaded.  In which case GetAncestorClassNames will
be used to find the first native super class.  This can be slow if temporary caching mode is not on.

methods.name: GetAsset
methods.doc: Returns the asset UObject if it is loaded or loads the asset if it is unloaded then returns the result

methods.name: GetBlueprintAssets
methods.doc: Gets asset data for all blueprint assets that match the filter. ClassPaths in the filter specify the blueprint's parent class.

methods.name: GetExportTextName
methods.doc: Returns the name for the asset in the form: Class'ObjectPath'

methods.name: GetFullName
methods.doc: Returns the full name for the asset in the form: Class ObjectPath

methods.name: GetTagValue
methods.doc: Gets the value associated with the given tag as a string

methods.name: IsAssetLoaded
methods.doc: Returns true if the asset is loaded

methods.name: IsRedirector
methods.doc: Returns true if the this asset is a redirector.

methods.name: IsUAsset
methods.doc: Returns true if this is the primary asset in a package, true for maps and assets but false for secondary objects like class redirectors

methods.name: IsValid
methods.doc: Checks to see if this AssetData refers to an asset or is NULL

methods.name: SetFilterTagsAndValues
methods.doc: Populates the FARFilters tags and values map with the passed in tags and values

methods.name: ToSoftObjectPath
methods.doc: Convert to a SoftObjectPath for loading
